hero.title: Chamber of Independent Entrepreneurs
hero.subtitle: Banja Luka
hero.description: Support and protection of entrepreneurs' interests in Republika Srpska

about.title: A Tradition of More Than 100 Years
about.description1: The Regional Chamber of Independent Entrepreneurs Banja Luka is an independent, professional, non-governmental and non-profit organization that unites independent entrepreneurs from 15 cities and municipalities in the Banja Luka region.
about.description2: Our chamber provides comprehensive support to entrepreneurs through education, consulting and protection of their business interests. With a tradition dating back to 1909, we continue to be a pillar of support for the entrepreneurial community.
about.description3: As part of the European network of entrepreneurs, we actively participate in international projects and EU programs. Contact us for information about current projects and cooperation opportunities.

history.title: Since 1909
history.description: More than 115 years of tradition and support for entrepreneurs

hero.title: Automatic Membership for All Entrepreneurs
hero.description: By registering your independent business in the Banja Luka region, you automatically become a member of our chamber with all benefits

automatic.title: Simple Membership Process
automatic.description: Chamber membership is automatic and begins the moment you register your independent business with the relevant authority

step1.title: Register Your Business
step1.description: Submit a request to register your independent business at the Registration Agency

step2.title: Automatic Enrollment
step2.description: The agency automatically registers your business with our chamber

step3.title: Receive Membership
step3.description: You become a full member with access to all services and benefits

infoBox.title: Important Note
infoBox.description: Membership is mandatory for all independent entrepreneurs operating in our region (15 cities and municipalities). The membership fee is paid once a year and covers all services and benefits provided by the chamber.

benefits.title: What You Get as a Member
benefits.description: As a member of our chamber, you have access to a wide range of services and benefits that will help you grow your business

legal.title: Legal Protection

education.title: Education & Training

administrative.title: Administrative Services

international.title: EU Projects

process.title: How to Register Your Business
process.description: A guide through the process of registering an independent business and automatically acquiring chamber membership

step1.title: Prepare Documentation
step1.details: ID card, unique citizen number (JMBG), birth certificate extract, and proof of residential address

step2.title: Submit Application
step2.details: You can submit a registration request in person at the Registration Agency or electronically via e-Register. You need to define the activity you will perform

step3.title: Wait for Approval
step3.details: The Registration Agency processes your request (usually 1-3 business days). After approval, you are automatically registered with our chamber

step4.title: Membership Activation
step4.details: We contact you via email and phone with membership details, membership card, and instructions for using all benefits

cta.title: Have questions about the process?
cta.description: Our team is here to help you with every step of registration and explain all membership details

faq.title: Questions & Answers
faq.description: Answers to the most common questions about chamber membership

item1.question: Is membership mandatory?
item1.answer: Yes, membership in the Chamber of Independent Entrepreneurs is mandatory for all independent entrepreneurs operating in the 15 municipalities of the Banja Luka region, in accordance with the Law on Chambers of Republika Srpska.

item2.question: How much is the annual membership fee?
item2.answer: The annual membership fee is determined based on your business's income level. You can find out the exact amount by contacting our office or via email. The fee covers all basic chamber services.

item3.question: When does my membership begin?
item3.answer: Your membership begins automatically on the date of registration of your independent business at the Registration Agency. You will receive a membership notification via email or mail within 7 days.

item4.question: What services are included in the membership fee?
item4.answer: The membership fee covers: legal consultations, representation before institutions, issuing basic certificates and confirmations, access to education (with discount), networking events, and business information.

item5.question: Can I cancel my membership?
item5.answer: Membership automatically ends when you close or transfer your independent business outside our region. For questions about membership termination, contact our administrative service.

item6.question: How can I use membership benefits?
item6.answer: After becoming a member, you will receive access to the online member portal where you can schedule consultations, register for education, and request document issuance. You can also contact us by phone or email.

hero.title: About the Regional Chamber of Independent Entrepreneurs
hero.description: The oldest and largest chamber region in Republika Srpska with over 115 years of tradition

timeline.title: Timeline of significant events
timeline.description: Overview of the most important moments in the development of our chamber through the decades

event1.title: Chamber founding
event1.description: The Crafts Chamber was established in Banja Luka, marking the beginning of organized association of the craft and entrepreneurial sector in the region.

event2.title: Post-war development
event2.description: Restoration of chamber operations after World War II. The chamber becomes a key institution for coordinating craftsmen and small entrepreneurs.

event3.title: Transition and modernization
event3.description: Transformation into the Chamber of Independent Entrepreneurs of Republika Srpska. Adaptation to market economy and new legal regulations.

event4.title: European integration
event4.description: Beginning of active cooperation with European chamber organizations and participation in EU projects for entrepreneurship development.

event5.title: Digital transformation
event5.description: Introduction of digital services for members, online platforms and modernization of business processes. We become a leader in digitalization of chamber services.

mission.title: Mission
mission.description: Providing comprehensive support to independent entrepreneurs through protection of their interests, education and creation of a favorable business environment.
mission.point1: Protection of members' rights and interests

vision.title: Vision
vision.description: To be the leading chamber organization that recognizes members' needs and actively contributes to entrepreneurship development in Republika Srpska.

value1.title: Integrity
value1.description: Transparency, honesty and ethics in all aspects of work

value2.title: Innovation
value2.description: Continuous service improvement and adaptation to members' needs

value3.title: Partnership
value3.description: Cooperation with members, institutions and international organizations

euProjects.title: EU projects and initiatives
euProjects.description: We actively participate in European projects that contribute to entrepreneurship development and capacity building of our members

project1.title: IPA funds for SMEs
project1.description: Support project for small and medium enterprises through EU IPA funds. Focus on digitalization and export orientation.

project2.title: Erasmus+ training
project2.description: Knowledge and experience exchange program with European chambers. Free training for members in entrepreneurship.

project3.title: COSME program
project3.description: Participation in the program for competitiveness of small and medium enterprises. Access to finance and new markets.

project4.title: Green transition
project4.description: Support project for transition to sustainable and ecological business practices. Consulting and financial support.

cta.title: Interested in EU projects?
cta.description: Contact us for more information about current projects and opportunities for your company

hero.title: 115 years of tradition and development
hero.description: A journey through time that shaped the largest chamber region in Republika Srpska

timeline.title: History through decades
timeline.description: Each period brought unique challenges and achievements that shaped our chamber

period1.title: Foundation and first steps
period1.event1: Founding of the Crafts Chamber in Banja Luka. First steps of organized association of craftsmen and traders in the region.
period1.event2: Expansion of chamber activities. Covered 15 municipalities with over 500 members.
period1.event3: First major educational campaign for craftsmen. Introduction of modern work standards.

period2.title: Post-war reconstruction and development
period2.event1: Restoration of chamber operations after World War II. New beginning for the craft and trade sector.
period2.event2: Golden era of craftsmanship. Chamber counts over 3,000 active members and launches numerous initiatives.
period2.event3: Modernization of services and expansion of international cooperation. First contacts with European chambers.

period3.title: Transition to market economy
period3.event1: Transformation into the Chamber of Independent Entrepreneurs of Republika Srpska. Adaptation to new legal frameworks.
period3.event2: Process digitalization. First online services for members and electronic archive.
period3.event3: Joining European chamber networks. Beginning of active participation in EU projects.

period4.title: Modern era and European integration
period4.event1: Membership in EUROCHAMBRES. Full integration into European entrepreneur network.
period4.event2: Launch of digital platforms for members. Complete digitalization of administrative services.
period4.event3: We become a leader in innovations among regional chambers. Over 11,000 active members.

gallery.title: Key events in our history
gallery.description: Photos and stories that witness our development through time

highlight1.title: Chamber founding 1909
highlight1.description: Historic moment when the Crafts Chamber was founded in Banja Luka, laying the foundation for organized entrepreneurship in the region.

highlight2.title: Post-war reconstruction
highlight2.description: Period of reconstruction and growth after World War II, when the chamber becomes a pillar of support for craftsmen and traders.

highlight3.title: Transformation into Chamber of IE
highlight3.description: Transition to market economy and transformation into modern Chamber of Independent Entrepreneurs.

highlight4.title: Digital era
highlight4.description: Introduction of cutting-edge technologies and digital platforms for providing services to members.

legacy.title: Our legacy
legacy.description: More than a century of experience, knowledge and dedication to entrepreneurship development in our region. Each generation contributed, building foundations for the future we know today.

hero.title: Chamber Bodies
hero.description: Transparency, professionalism and dedication to our members' interests

leadership.title: Chamber Presidency
leadership.description: Elected representatives who lead the chamber and represent the interests of all independent entrepreneurs

president.name: Marko Marković
president.bio: With over 20 years of experience in entrepreneurship, he leads the chamber with a vision of modernization and digitalization of services. Dedicated to strengthening the position of independent entrepreneurs in the economic system of Republika Srpska.

vicePresident1.name: Jelena Jovanović
vicePresident1.bio: Focused on education and development of entrepreneurial competencies, she coordinates training programs and mentorship for members. Expert in craft activities with many years of experience.

vicePresident2.name: Nikola Nikolić
vicePresident2.bio: Responsible for international cooperation and European integration. Actively participates in projects that connect domestic entrepreneurs with European markets and opportunities.

boards.title: Management structure
boards.description: Four key bodies that ensure democratic and transparent functioning of the chamber

assembly.name: Chamber Assembly
assembly.description: The highest body of the chamber that makes key decisions about the chamber's operations, development and policy.
assembly.resp1: Adoption of the statute and other key chamber acts
assembly.resp2: Adoption of annual work program and financial plan
assembly.resp3: Election of Management and Supervisory Board members
assembly.resp4: Consideration of reports on work and financial operations

supervisory.name: Supervisory Board
supervisory.description: Control body that oversees the legality and regularity of the chamber's work and its bodies.
supervisory.resp1: Supervision of Management Board work and chamber operations
supervisory.resp2: Control of financial operations and budget execution
supervisory.resp3: Submission of reports to the Assembly with observations and recommendations
supervisory.resp4: Protection of members' interests and proper work of chamber bodies

management.name: Management Board
management.description: Executive body that manages the chamber's work between Assembly sessions.
management.resp1: Implementation of Assembly decisions and realization of work program
management.resp2: Management of financial resources and chamber property
management.resp3: Representation and advocacy of chamber interests
management.resp4: Making business decisions and monitoring operational work

arbitration.name: Arbitration Court
arbitration.description: Independent body for resolving disputes between chamber members in accordance with the law.
arbitration.resp1: Resolution of commercial disputes between chamber members
arbitration.resp2: Arbitration proceedings under member contracts containing arbitration clause
arbitration.resp3: Mediation and peaceful resolution of business disagreements

governance.title: Democratic governance
governance.description: All chamber bodies are elected democratically by members, ensuring that every entrepreneur's voice is heard. The work of bodies is transparent and in accordance with law and chamber statute.

hero.title: Chamber annual reports
hero.description: Annual reports on activities, financial operations and chamber work results

reports.title: Annual reports
reports.description: Download detailed reports on chamber activities for each year

report2024.title: Annual Report for 2024
report2024.description: Complete analysis of activities, projects and financial operations of the chamber during 2024. Overview of membership, educational programs and international cooperation.

report2023.title: Annual Report for 2023
report2023.description: Detailed presentation of all chamber activities, membership statistics, implemented projects and financial report for 2023.

report2022.title: Annual Report for 2022
report2022.description: Annual overview of chamber work focusing on new initiatives, membership growth and successfully implemented projects during 2022.

report2021.title: Annual Report for 2021
report2021.description: Report on chamber activities in 2021, including statistics, financial data and overview of major achievements.

report2020.title: Annual Report for 2020
report2020.description: Annual report for 2020 with detailed presentation of chamber work under challenging COVID-19 pandemic conditions.

info.title: Transparent operations
info.description: All reports undergo Supervisory Board audit and are adopted by the Chamber Assembly. They are publicly available in accordance with transparency and accountability principles.
